concept.title: Command Setups
concept.shortdesc: Commands can accept parameters. Collections of parameters that change the behavior of the command are setups. Setups come after the command in blocks, delimited into blocks by square brackets.

conbody.p: Setups come in two types: options and settings.
Options are keywords. Commands that accept options can accept one or more keywords in an options block, separated by a comma.
Settings are key/value pairs. Commands that accept settings can accept one or more settings in a settings block, separated by a comma.
Setup blocks must not mix options and settings.
